newsitem.title: USA: Kohl's Nov same store sales up.
newsitem.headline: Kohl's Nov same store sales up.

text.p: Kohl's Corp said Thursday that same store sales for the four-week period ended November 30 rose 18.1 percent, excluding electronics.
Total sales for the four-week period gained 27.6 percent to $296.6 million from $232.4 million.
Kohl's electronics business has been discontinued and is not included in same-store sales data.

Due to a shift in the fiscal accounting calendar, the fiscal month ending dates are one week later this year than a year ago. On a calendar basis, matching the periods ended November 30, 1996 with the periods ended December 2, 1995, total sales increased 18.5 percent for the month, and comparable store sales increased 8.6 percent excluding electronics.
"We are extremely pleased with the start of the holiday season. Our increase was on top of a 10.5 percent comparable store sales gain a year ago," William Kellogg, chairman, said in a statement.
For the 10 months ended November 30, sales were up 26.7 percent over the 10 months ended November 25. On a comparable store basis, sales increased 12.1 percent.
